title: Daily protocol delayed by oversleeping staff
vignette: Two senior technicians oversleep; the day's scheduled system checks start an hour late. Should the team run them now or postpone to the next cycle?

options.text: Proceed quickly even if after the scheduled time.
Cancel and wait until the next day.

title: Shortage of approved fuel for constant flame
vignette: A critical pilot flame is about to go out. Only leftover event decorations are available as makeshift fuel. Use them or wait for correct material?

options.text: Use leftover festival decorations as fuel.
Do not improvise; wait for proper wood.

title: Non-certified professional helping with procedures
vignette: A volunteer group offers to assist with the daily institutional procedures.

options.text: Allow limited help under supervision.
Only certified professionals may perform any part.

title: Substandard specimen selected under time-pressure
vignette: In a rush, staff pick a sample with visible defects for the daily quality-control test. Replace it or proceed to avoid delay?

options.text: Replace it immediately with a proper specimen.
Proceed to avoid delays.

title: Performance group wants to expand program
vignette: The facility's official performance group proposes adding extra pieces to the standard program. Allow creativity or stick to the approved schedule?

options.text: Allow creative expression to inspire visitors.
Stick to the prescribed program only.

title: Cleaning waste on holiday
vignette: The main platform is overflowing with waste during a holiday.

options.text: Remove it despite holiday work limits.
Wait until after the holiday ends.

title: Precision tool left outside overnight
vignette: A senior tech leaves a precision knife—normally stored in a controlled area—outdoors overnight. Next morning: quick rinse and use, or re-certify first?

options.text: Rinse it and use it; no harm done.
The utensil must be re-certified before use.

title: Role dispute between senior operators
vignette: Two senior operators argue about who performs which calibration step. Decide by lottery for peace, or award roles by seniority?

options.text: Decide by lottery to keep peace.
Let seniority determine the roles.

title: Insufficient reagents prepared
vignette: Only half the usual portion of reagents is mixed for the day's tests.

options.text: Use what is available rather than none.
Delay until the full measure can be prepared.

title: New supervisor proposes more efficient order
vignette: A newly-appointed supervisor suggests re-ordering a ten-step daily protocol for speed, assuring no risk increase. Adopt or reject?

options.text: Follow the traditional sequence strictly.
Adopt the more efficient order.

title: Early-bird visitors request pre-dawn entry
vignette: Tour groups arrive at 4 a.m. hoping to watch the morning procedure. Open doors early, or keep standard hours?

options.text: Open early to accommodate them.
Keep standard hours for order.

title: Minor damage on technician's protective gear
vignette: A tear is noticed in a technician's protective gear right before the procedure.

options.text: Ignore and proceed to avoid delay.
Replace or mend it first.

title: Specialized powder spilled during prep
vignette: During preparation, a scoop of specialized reagent powder falls onto a clean floor. Sweep and use if uncontaminated, or discard for safety?

options.text: Gather and use it if clean.
Discard it for safety.

title: Staff member collapses mid-procedure
vignette: A worker collapses from heat halfway through a critical step. Pause to aid and substitute staff, or finish the step before helping?

options.text: Pause to provide care and replace him.
Continue without interruption.

title: Untrained technician assigned duties
vignette: A new recruit is asked to perform part of the procedure without prior training.

options.text: Allow under supervision to learn.
Only trained technicians may serve.
